items.title: Premier League: 10 things to look out for this weekend
items.summary: Chelsea need to avoid long-throw blues, plus: a vacant spot for Liverpool and West Ham‚Äôs best hope for survival Race for the golden boot: Premier League top scorers Can the 198th derby be any spicier for Manchester United and their latest interim manager, Michael Carrick? This is his second caretaker tenure though the three games of November-December 2021 (beating Villarreal and Arsenal, drawing with Chelsea) hardly compares to sending out an XI to try to beat Manchester City in Saturday‚Äôs early kick-off. Pep Guardiola‚Äôs high-performing unit remain in contention on all fronts. Carrick takes charge of a United suffering the aftershocks of a latest manager sacking, hoping to salvage the season via European qualification. The lad from Wallsend has 17 games to do so ‚Äì his new team are in seventh place on 32 points, so victory over City would be a fine start. But you wonder if the match might end with Carrick and United humbled or, even worse, humiliated. Jamie Jackson Manchester United v Manchester City, Saturday 12.30pm (all times GMT) Chelsea v Brentford, Saturday 3pm Leeds v Fulham, Saturday 3pm Liverpool v Burnley, Saturday 3pm Continue reading...

items.title: Man Utd's Mart√≠nez: Wanted to quit after ACL tear
items.summary: Manchester United defender Lisandro Mart√≠nez has revealed that during the darkest moments of his recovery from a torn ACL, he seriously considered walking away from football.

items.title: Pulisic stays on bench as Rabiot inspires Milan win
items.summary: AC Milan won 3-1 at in-form Como on Thursday, with Adrien Rabiot winning a penalty and then scoring two goals.

items.title: Mexico calls up dual-nationals Ledezma, Guti√©rrez
items.summary: United States-Mexico dual-nationals Richard Ledezma and Brian Guti√©rrez earned their first call-ups for Mexico's senior national team on Thursday ahead of non-FIFA date friendlies against Panama on Jan. 22 and Bolivia on Jan 25.

items.title: UEFA: $55M loss due to drop in U.S. dollar
items.summary: The U.S. dollar value dropped about 9% against a range of foreign currencies in the first months of 2025 and UEFA blames that fall for a $55M loss of revenue.

items.title: Barca win 11th in a row; Flick calls it 'nothing'
items.summary: Hansi Flick brushed off Barcelona's 11-game winning run as "nothing" as they beat Racing Santander 2-0 on Thursday to book their place in the Copa del Rey quarterfinals.

items.title: Hier kijk je vrijdag live naar de loting voor de kwartfinale van de KNVB Beker
items.summary: Zeven van de acht kwartfinalisten in de Eurojackpot KNVB Beker zijn bekend. De laatste kwartfinalist komt uit het duel tussen De Treffers en NEC. Hieronder lees je wanneer de loting plaatsvindt, welke ploegen er in de koker gaan en waar de loting wordt uitgezonden.

items.title: Raspadori verlaat Atl√©tico na half jaar: re√ºnie met Scamacca een feit
items.summary: Giacomo Raspadori is na een half jaar bij Atl√©tico Madrid weer terug in de Serie A. Het wordt goede oude tijden herleven voor de spits, die bij Atalanta weer gaat samenspelen met Gianluca Scamacca.

items.title: Kruys weet het zeker: 'Een honderd procent strafschop'
items.summary: Rick Kruys is blij dat FC Volendam ten koste van Sparta door is naar de kwartfinale van de Eurojackpot KNVB Beker. Over het strafschopmoment vlak voor de winnende goal van Robert M√ºhren was de trainer uitgesproken.

items.title: Barcelona heeft De Jong niet nodig voor bekerzege op tweededivisionist
items.summary: Barcelona heeft zich donderdagavond geplaatst voor de kwartfinale van de Copa del Rey. In tegenstelling tot Real Madrid lukte het de Catalanen wel om af te rekenen met een tweededivisionist uit Spanje: Racing Santander.

items.title: Volendam voor het eerst in negen jaar naar de kwartfinale
items.summary: Vandaag was er in de VI Live onder meer aandacht voor de Eurojackpot KNVB Beker en Racing Santander - Barcelona in het Copa del Rey-toernooi. Daarnaast kegelde FC Volendam Sparta uit de beker. Lees de volledige avond hier terug.

items.title: PL Predictions: Destruction derby? City set to smash United
items.summary: Our football betting expert Jones Knows provides his insight across the Premier League weekend and tips Manchester City to win a thrilling Manchester derby.

items.title: Littler thrashes Lim in Bahrain comeback after Humphries impresses
items.summary: Back-to-back world champion Luke Littler made a winning start to the Bahrain Darts Masters with a dominant 6-1 victory over Paul Lim, as Luke Humphries and Gerwyn Price also progressed to the quarter-finals.

items.title: Celtic make enquiry over West Ham striker Wilson
items.summary: Celtic have made an enquiry for West Ham striker Callum Wilson.

items.title: Geopolitical football: Iran? Trump? How the game can stand strong in a fractured world
items.summary: The 2026 World Cup is set to be a polarising event but, even if it will not be the first to be politically contentious, it will expose a growing unease Five months out from the World Cup the politics are impossible to avoid. There are concerns relating to one of the host countries, the US, with armed immigration officials roaming through its cities and visa restrictions stepped up against foreign visitors. One qualifying nation, Iran, is experiencing a public uprising against its leadership, with the regime attacking its citizens in response. Among other qualifiers there are concerns over democratic backsliding in Tunisia, ecological crimes in Ecuador and , in the future host country Saudi Arabia. And that‚Äôs just for starters. It sometimes feels as if this summer‚Äôs tournament, the one Gianni Infantino recently described as ‚Äúthe greatest show ever on planet Earth‚Äù, will serve as an inescapable reminder of the depressing state of the world in 2026. It could yet be an event that goes down in infamy. But it is hardly the only tournament to have prompted ethical concerns and serves as a reminder that the issue of how global sport should engage with such issues has remained largely unresolved. Continue reading...

items.title: Players need social skills for World Cup - Tuchel
items.summary: England manager Thomas Tuchel says players will need the right "social skills" and personality to make his World Cup squad.

items.title: Inquiry launched after Chelsea fans complain about policing at end of Charlton game
items.summary: Fans upset at being unexpectedly held back at the Valley Police action ‚Äòuncomfortably like that from past decades‚Äô The Metropolitan police has commissioned an independent investigation after receiving complaints about its treatment of Chelsea supporters after the west London club‚Äôs FA Cup tie at Charlton last Saturday. The Chelsea Supporters‚Äô Trust (CST) called for action earlier this week after writing to the force to voice concerns regarding an operation in which approximately 3,000 travelling fans were held back outside the Valley without prior notice following the conclusion of a game that kicked off at 8pm in freezing temperatures. Continue reading...

items.title: $200,000 for nine-darter then bullseye? Saudi tournament offers new prize
items.summary: Players competing in the Riyadh Season Saudi Arabia Darts Masters could win an astonishing $200,000 if they produce a nine-darter followed by a bullseye in the World Series of Darts event.

items.title: Smith: I am ready for unification fight with Stevenson or Lopez
items.summary: Dalton Smith says he is ready for a unification fight with either Shakur Stevenson or Teofimo Lopez after he claimed the WBC super-lightweight title and believes rival Adam Azim has to prove himself at world level before they fight.

items.title: After agony in Morocco, what's next for Salah with club and country?
items.summary: What does Mohamed Salah's future hold for Liverpool and Egypt after their Afcon disappointment?
